align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57835"comment_id="1435092"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Babylon-57835.html?ccid=1435092#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1430212" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1430212" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="frozen_music"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1399896"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1399896.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="frozen_music" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Castile-4564.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.4564.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Castile"title="Castile"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1430212ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1430212" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1399896">frozen_music</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-10-18">10/18/21 10:41</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I smelt a great many Penhaligons perfumes in the store and have been working through their two scent libraries since. Babylon was, and still is, a clear winner for me. It's become my signature scent. <br />
<br />
This is beautifully warm and spicy and makes me feel like I'm being wrapped in a soothing hug as soon as I spray it. Lovely vanilla base with almost plum notes. Perfect for autumn and winter. Slightly reminiscent of a boozy plum pudding but nothing so sharp and crass as that. The woody notes add depth. Perfectly blended, warm and classy.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57835"comment_id="1430212"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Babylon-57835.html?ccid=1430212#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1428277" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1428277" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Hr2lrn"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1206417"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Hr2lrn" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1428277ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1428277" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1206417">Hr2lrn</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-10-14">10/14/21 18:26</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A warm, unique and comforting vanilla with an amber undertone. Truly a favorite from first sniff, and I have many vanilla scents, and many amber scents. The performance is impressive. Happy I own a bottle. This becomes my favorite Penhaligons scent, dethroning Cairo, who now earns the silver medal. And that is no small feat, because that is a memorable fragrance as well.<br />
I have worn it on two different days, and each day received a compliment. That is notable, particularly since each day it was hours after I applied the scent.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57835"comment_id="1428277"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Babylon-57835.html?ccid=1428277#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1401831" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1401831" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Anitanita."/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1379479"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Anitanita." style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Xerjoff/Coro-Selfridges-Exclusive-55950.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.55950.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Coro (Selfridges Exclusive)"title="Coro (Selfridges Exclusive)"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1401831ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1401831" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1379479">Anitanita.</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-08-31">08/31/21 04:34</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Wonderful spicy vanilla . Perfect for autumn and winter time as nutmeg is a King in this juice.<br />
Very sweet and very spicy,it has got niche quality too.<br />
Not the longest lasting but in my opinion is worth your money if you like vanilla and spices.<br />
Saffron is not as prominent in here.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57835"comment_id="1401831"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Babylon-57835.html?ccid=1401831#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1400690" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1400690" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="parispeach"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/500472"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="parispeach" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Roja-Dove/Manhattan-Eau-de-Parfum-77295.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.77295.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Manhattan Eau de Parfum"title="Manhattan Eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1400690ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1400690" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/500472">parispeach</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-08-29">08/29/21 05:21</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>One of my favourites from Penhaligons. <br />
<br />
Im a lover of Vanilla and this again is another brilliant take on a spiced Vanilla with Saffron, Cypriol, Nargamotha. This adds a greener, woody, spicy feel to it. <br />
<br />
This is a Vanilla version of Cairo. I love what they have done here. Its not original or unique, it has some Kalemat, Raghba vibes but completely different quality.<br />
<br />
This is a very cosy and comforting spiced Vanilla. No sugary sweetness here. <br />
<br />
In terms of longevity this is great. Beautiful silage and lasts all day. <br />
<br />
Next up on the list Halfeti Cedar.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57835"comment_id="1400690"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Babylon-57835.html?ccid=1400690#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1395531" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; In the dry down you get more of the nutmeg/ coriander and cypriol oil as the prominent note. A spicy smokey vanilla scent. Very unique since I have never tried anything like this before.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57835"comment_id="1392065"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Babylon-57835.html?ccid=1392065#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1388597" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1388597" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Shay-Vizballs"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1372028"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Shay-Vizballs" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1388597ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1388597" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.74); Do yourself a favour and try a sample of it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57835"comment_id="1388597"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Babylon-57835.html?ccid=1388597#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1361643" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1361643" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="penguinrabbit"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1349583"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="penguinrabbit" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Clean/Fresh-Laundry-6763.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.6763.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Fresh Laundry"title="Fresh Laundry"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1361643ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1361643" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1349583">penguinrabbit</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-06-17">06/17/21 14:47</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Strong, spicy vanilla. Reminiscent of vanilla chai. I like this but could get much cheaper fragrances with similar profiles. Given the variety of Penhaligon's fragrances, I'd rather have something more luxurious feeling like Cairo, Favourite, or Empressa for the price of a bottle. Obviously, this is very personal. <br />
<br />
I completely disagree with the people saying Halfeti is better. I prefer this to Halfeti which I find a bit masculine for my tastes even though it's supposedly unisex which doesn't usually bother me. Halfeti is more complex though. My favorite trade route scent is Cairo. The rose in Cairo just gives it a slightly more complex feel.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57835"comment_id="1361643"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Babylon-57835.html?ccid=1361643#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1357648" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1357648" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ingeneuxo"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1280821"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1280821.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ingeneuxo" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Byredo/Rose-Of-No-Man-s-Land-31931.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.31931.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Rose Of No Man's Land"title="Rose Of No Man's Land"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1357648ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1357648" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1280821">ingeneuxo</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-06-10">06/10/21 07:52</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>-Opens as a nice ambery scent, with a slight plasticky bite to it.<br />
-Linear scent.<br />
-Babylon shares the vibe of Diptyque Eau Duelle.<br />
-They are similar enough that you probably don't need both. I'd say Babylon is more for those who like a pinch of spice in their aromatic amber fragrances. (-)<br />
<br />
Other Recommendations:<br />
-Halfeti is more worth the coin if you're looking to get a spicy fragrance from Penhaligon's. (Halfeti does lean masculine, and is more of a black-tie event scent though.)<br />
-Alternatively, Savoy Steam is an awesome expensive spa scent to check out.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57835"comment_id="1357648"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Babylon-57835.html?ccid=1357648#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1349119" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1349119" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="J350"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1201660"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="J350" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1349119ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1349119" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1201660">J350</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-05-25">05/25/21 11:28</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The vanilla is too overpowering on this. It smells very similar to Swiss Arabian Shaghaf Oud which I own and possibly a lite version of Jo Malone Velvet Rose and Oud. Starts off with a good hint of saffron then dries down to a very overpowering vanilla. Its not bad, I like it. Its not good either for me to want to own one since I already have two that is similar (Jo Malone Velvet Rose and Oud, Swiss Arabian Shaghaf Oud). Im a huge fan of Arabic perfumes but this one has lost its niche status. Scents like this can easily be found and bought in the Middle East. <br />
<br />
Not for me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57835"comment_id="1349119"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Babylon-57835.html?ccid=1349119#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1347974" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1347974" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="clarag33"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1324371"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="clarag33" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Tauer-Perfumes/09-Orange-Star-8670.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.8670.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="09 Orange Star"title="09 Orange Star"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1347974ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1347974" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1324371">clarag33</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-05-23">05/23/21 04:46</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Definitely middle easter but nothing to write home about.  From penhaligon's I much prefer Vaara or Halfeti</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57835"comment_id="1347974"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Babylon-57835.html?ccid=1347974#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1340295" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1340295" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Russruss"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1309816"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1309816.gif" class="comments-avatar"alt="Russruss" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1340295ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1340295" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1309816">Russruss</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-05-09">05/09/21 02:30</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Smells like cornflakes to me. Really nice scent.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57835"comment_id="1340295"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Babylon-57835.html?ccid=1340295#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1326438" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1326438" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="logocracy"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1274576"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="logocracy" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1326438ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1326438" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1274576">logocracy</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-04-16">04/16/21 00:49</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I detect a stronger vetiver note in this than cedarwood. The vanilla is great and the dry down also has a light sandalwood aromachemical in the base.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57835"comment_id="1326438"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Babylon-57835.html?ccid=1326438#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1321780" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1321780" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="rosequeen"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1169399"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1169399.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="rosequeen" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Raphael/Replique-5132.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.5132.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Replique"title="Replique"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1321780ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1321780" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1169399">rosequeen</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-04-08">04/08/21 11:58</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Oh yeah, I really like this stuff.  I thought I would from the time I first read, probably here, that it was going to come out and I read the list of the notes.  So I've been sitting like a buzzard on a branch waiting for its arrival. Alas, it arrived in the UK at least a year ago, but no one was selling decants then and I wasn't going to drop $258 plus whatever god-awful shipping rates they're charging for UK-US packages right now on juice I haven't smelled.  So it's been online at full retail in the US maybe a 3 weeks and several eBay sellers are offering samples and decants.  All hail them!<br />
<br />
Babylon is everything you're hoping.  I'm an easy mark for anything bearing nutmeg, and it comes on strong right away.  It's definitely a Middle Eastern woodsy scent, but not bombastic.  Acceptable....well maybe at the outer reaches of acceptable; rosequeen has a notorious range of what passes for acceptable.  But I don't think you'll be shunned if you wear this in a public place among strangers.  I'm headed to the grocery store at high noon in a few minutes, so I'll be testing this theory.  It's warm and spicy but not overwhelming.  Distinct from Penhaligon's other Trade Routes scents too.  Nowhere near as sharp as original Halfeti or As Sawria (love that one, but it does reek).  <br />
<br />
Most people will consider this a fall and winter scent, so it's unfortunate that it's arriving in the US in April.  Of course because of Covid a lot of people may not feel safe heading to the department stores until fall anyway.  And since all the big ones in the US anyway that will carry Penhaligon are in Chapter 11 bankruptcy, if they don't reorganize their debt they may not be open by September. (And won't we be in trouble, those of us who test perfumes in department stores by spraying fast and running away quickly).  Ugh, but I think Babylon will still be wearable on a warm day up to maybe 80 degrees.  But I have a notorious wide range on what to wear on a hot day too, so maybe not.<br />
<br />
Babylon died down at about 3 hours last night, but I could still smell it at about 7 hours.  So it's not one of those expensive scents that only lasts 90 minutes.  Don't be concerned about that.  Not a blind buy, but if you've sprung for a big decant and are now enthralled, you'll maybe wish you'd just blown it on the full bottle (until you remember how often you've done that and been disappointed and kicking yourself).</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57835"comment_id="1321780"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Babylon-57835.html?ccid=1321780#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1310889" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1310889" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Janulka098"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1276764"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Janulka098" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Rasasi/Amber-Oudh-8736.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.8736.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Amber Oudh"title="Amber Oudh"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1310889ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1310889" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1276764">Janulka098</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-03-20">03/20/21 05:58</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Lovely fragrance. Warm and spicy with lovely vanilla and loads of cedar. Reminded me of something I used to own... kept bugging me for a little while and then I remembered - it has similarities to Arabian Oud Kalemat or scent story 24 - Babylon to my nose has more cedar and is sweeter with vanilla and has a lovely cinnamon in the background (must be nutmeg as there is no cinnamon listed) Its beautiful and worth a bottle.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57835"comment_id="1310889"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Babylon-57835.html?ccid=1310889#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1246096" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1246096" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="zhiang0113"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1173932"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1173932.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="zhiang0113" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Bath-Body-Works/Vanilla-Romance-96320.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.96320.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Vanilla Romance"title="Vanilla Romance"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1246096ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1246096" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1173932">zhiang0113</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-11-08">11/08/20 05:49</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I love Babylon - it smells like having a nice cup of vanilla latte by a log cabin fireplace.<br />
<br />
It has a delicious, exquisite balance of smoky cypriol, (and I mean this in the best way possible) pencil shavings-like cedarwood, with a touch of boozy, complex vanilla to sweeten and round things off.<br />
<br />
Babylon makes me feel nostalgic for a rustic upbringing I never had, and I'm glad to have a bottle of it in my collection.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57835"comment_id="1246096"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Babylon-57835.html?ccid=1246096#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                    </div>
</div>

padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1246096" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="zhiang0113"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1173932"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1173932.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="zhiang0113" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Bath-Body-Works/Vanilla-Romance-96320.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.96320.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Vanilla Romance"title="Vanilla Romance"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1246096ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1246096" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1173932">zhiang0113</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-11-08">11/08/20 05:49</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I love Babylon - it smells like having a nice cup of vanilla latte by a log cabin fireplace.<br />
<br />
It has a delicious, exquisite balance of smoky cypriol, (and I mean this in the best way possible) pencil shavings-like cedarwood, with a touch of boozy, complex vanilla to sweeten and round things off.<br />
<br />
Babylon makes me feel nostalgic for a rustic upbringing I never had, and I'm glad to have a bottle of it in my collection.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57835"comment_id="1246096"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Babylon-57835.html?ccid=1246096#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1310889" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1310889" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Janulka098"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1276764"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Janulka098" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Rasasi/Amber-Oudh-8736.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.8736.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Amber Oudh"title="Amber Oudh"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1310889ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1310889" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1276764">Janulka098</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-03-20">03/20/21 05:58</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Lovely fragrance. Warm and spicy with lovely vanilla and loads of cedar. Reminded me of something I used to own... kept bugging me for a little while and then I remembered - it has similarities to Arabian Oud Kalemat or scent story 24 - Babylon to my nose has more cedar and is sweeter with vanilla and has a lovely cinnamon in the background (must be nutmeg as there is no cinnamon listed) Its beautiful and worth a bottle.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57835"comment_id="1310889"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Babylon-57835.html?ccid=1310889#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2198216" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2198216" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Aeternitas"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/603"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.603.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Aeternitas" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Hanae-Mori/Magical-Moon-1578.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.1578.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Magical Moon"title="Magical Moon"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2198216ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2198216" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/603">Aeternitas</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-24">06/24/24 12:18</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I bought a decant of Babylon to compare to my newly discovered and beloved Bewitching Yasmine after reading a few reviews saying they are very close. I have worn it over the course of this past week, so I'll review Babylon on its own merit, and then I'll go into a comparison with Yasmine. <br />
<br />
<b>Babylon</b> is a simple and warm offering from Penhaligon's. It is mostly woody and vanillic on me...neither too woody nor too vanillic, instead brilliantly centered between the two, which is what makes it a perfect unisex fragrance. Though I said "simple" (considering the minimal note profile), it's beautifully crafted and smooth. Part of its simplicity is that I find it quite linear, but once again, it's done very well; there's nothing wrong with linear if you're getting what you want out of your perfume. Longevity, however... not worth the price. It disappears after an hour, which is pretty disappointing for this level of perfumery. I will save the rest of my decant to test in winter and hopefully remember to update.  <br />
For now, I find Babylon a bit lackluster in comparison to....<br />
<br />
...<b>The Bewitching Yasmine</b>. If you're not <i>really</i> looking for differences, I can see where one could think they are close, especially going by the initial spray of each. Sure, they are cousins with vanilla and spices. But... Babylon does not have the sweet and alluring jasmine note that Yasmine has, which is quite obvious. Yasmine is a heavy-hitter with coffee, incense, and oud... all of which are also not present in Babylon. I find them both warm and luxe, but still different in character... Babylon is one to shake your hand and walk you to your door, whereas Bewitching Yasmine will drape herself over you and ask you to come upstairs. <br />
<br />
My personal bias is to a boldly seductive perfume like Yasmine, so take this review how you will. They're both great perfumes, it just depends on what you're looking for. <br />
Just wanted to pound out my little comparison (and opinion) for anyone else exploring Penhaligon's perfumes.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57835"comment_id="2198216"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Babylon-57835.html?ccid=2198216#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1321780" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1321780" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="rosequeen"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1169399"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1169399.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="rosequeen" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Raphael/Replique-5132.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.5132.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Replique"title="Replique"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1321780ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1321780" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1169399">rosequeen</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-04-08">04/08/21 11:58</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Oh yeah, I really like this stuff.  I thought I would from the time I first read, probably here, that it was going to come out and I read the list of the notes.  So I've been sitting like a buzzard on a branch waiting for its arrival. Alas, it arrived in the UK at least a year ago, but no one was selling decants then and I wasn't going to drop $258 plus whatever god-awful shipping rates they're charging for UK-US packages right now on juice I haven't smelled.  So it's been online at full retail in the US maybe a 3 weeks and several eBay sellers are offering samples and decants.  All hail them!<br />
<br />
Babylon is everything you're hoping.  I'm an easy mark for anything bearing nutmeg, and it comes on strong right away.  It's definitely a Middle Eastern woodsy scent, but not bombastic.  Acceptable....well maybe at the outer reaches of acceptable; rosequeen has a notorious range of what passes for acceptable.  But I don't think you'll be shunned if you wear this in a public place among strangers.  I'm headed to the grocery store at high noon in a few minutes, so I'll be testing this theory.  It's warm and spicy but not overwhelming.  Distinct from Penhaligon's other Trade Routes scents too.  Nowhere near as sharp as original Halfeti or As Sawria (love that one, but it does reek).  <br />
<br />
Most people will consider this a fall and winter scent, so it's unfortunate that it's arriving in the US in April.  Of course because of Covid a lot of people may not feel safe heading to the department stores until fall anyway.  And since all the big ones in the US anyway that will carry Penhaligon are in Chapter 11 bankruptcy, if they don't reorganize their debt they may not be open by September. (And won't we be in trouble, those of us who test perfumes in department stores by spraying fast and running away quickly).  Ugh, but I think Babylon will still be wearable on a warm day up to maybe 80 degrees.  But I have a notorious wide range on what to wear on a hot day too, so maybe not.<br />
<br />
Babylon died down at about 3 hours last night, but I could still smell it at about 7 hours.  So it's not one of those expensive scents that only lasts 90 minutes.  Don't be concerned about that.  Not a blind buy, but if you've sprung for a big decant and are now enthralled, you'll maybe wish you'd just blown it on the full bottle (until you remember how often you've done that and been disappointed and kicking yourself).</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57835"comment_id="1321780"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Babylon-57835.html?ccid=1321780#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1400690" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1400690" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="parispeach"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/500472"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="parispeach" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Roja-Dove/Manhattan-Eau-de-Parfum-77295.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.77295.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Manhattan Eau de Parfum"title="Manhattan Eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1400690ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1400690" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/500472">parispeach</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-08-29">08/29/21 05:21</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>One of my favourites from Penhaligons. <br />
<br />
Im a lover of Vanilla and this again is another brilliant take on a spiced Vanilla with Saffron, Cypriol, Nargamotha. This adds a greener, woody, spicy feel to it. <br />
<br />
This is a Vanilla version of Cairo. I love what they have done here. Its not original or unique, it has some Kalemat, Raghba vibes but completely different quality.<br />
<br />
This is a very cosy and comforting spiced Vanilla. No sugary sweetness here. <br />
<br />
In terms of longevity this is great. Beautiful silage and lasts all day. <br />
<br />
Next up on the list Halfeti Cedar.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57835"comment_id="1400690"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Babylon-57835.html?ccid=1400690#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="57835" sentiment="positive"></reviews-infinity>
            </div>
</div>
</div><div class="tabs-panel" id="popular-negative-reviews"><div class="cell">
    <div class="strike-title"><span>Most Popular Negative Reviews</span></div>
    <div class="grid-x grid-padding-x grid-margin-y" style="position: relative; padding: 0 0.25rem 0 0.25rem;">
                            <div id="parent1517890" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1517890" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Voice-Of-God"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1207310"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1207310.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Voice-Of-God" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1517890ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1517890" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1207310">Voice-Of-God</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-03-06">03/06/22 15:50</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I tried this today in my local Penhaligon's. (I already have Halfeti &amp; Cairo)<br />
As the salesperson sprayed it on a card she said, "It's very manly and exotic." <br />
<br />
After a sniff or two (of what seemed to my nose to be a weak odour similar to Lattafa Raghba), I replied, "I can't really smell anything much. It seems to me to have far less projection than Halfeti &amp; Cairo."<br />
<br />
She remarked, "Yes, Babylon's very soft... it's somewhat weaker than those two."<br />
<br />
I jokingly replied, "It's weaker than my 90 year old Grandmother's bladder. The 'Babylon' they refer to in this is more evocative of the spaceship air freshener in Babylon 5 rather than Babylon in Mesopotamia."  ;)<br />
<br />
She was speechless for a few seconds and then said, "Have you tried Constantinople?"<br />
<br />
I tried Constantinople... it was a little bit stronger smelling than Babylon and seemed nice, but in a 50.00 for 100 ml kinda nice. As I left I remarked, "I think I'll pass today, thanks anyway." ;)<br />
<br />
To avoid constantly sniffing your wrist every 2 minutes to double check if you've applied Babylon or not, and to save any disappointment, I would definitely try before you buy. ;)</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57835"comment_id="1517890"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Babylon-57835.html?ccid=1517890#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1844084" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1844084" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="AstridCN"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1759911"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="AstridCN" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1844084ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1844084" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1759911">AstridCN</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-05-29">05/29/23 02:18</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I loved it and then I hated it. It started very rich with the spices from the topnotes strongly coming through. I personally really do not enjoy a vanilla forward fragrance, but at first this seemed like the perfect vanilla fragrance for me. You get the base of vanilla but it is layered under the spices of the topnotes which makes it come forward a lot more subtle. This was the love part. However after wearing it for 2 to 3 hours, all I got was full vanilla. All other elements of this perfume had left the stage and all I could still sense was just plain, strong vanilla. And like I said earlier, that just really isn't a note for me. What started as the idea of the perfect subtle vanilla fragrance mixed with perfectly balanced saffron ( contrary to vanilla one of my favorite notes), became an absolute let down. <br />
<br />
Even if you are a big fan of vanilla fragrances, I still find this fragrance disappointing since after just a short amount of time it loses around 85% of it depth and you are left with just one note out of the 7 original ones.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="57835"comment_id="1844084"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Babylon-57835.html?ccid=1844084#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="57835" sentiment="negative"></reviews-infinity>
            </div>
</div>

        <div class="strike-title"><span>Perfume Reviews</span></div>
    <div class="latest-list flex-container">
        <img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/m.228.jpg" style="width: 60px; height: 64px; margin-right: 0.5em; flex-shrink: 0"/>
        <a href="/perfume/Dior/Fahrenheit-228.html#cc2367116"><span class="link-span"></span>
            <span class="brand">Dior</span><br>            <span class="ztworowseclipse">Fahrenheit</span>
        </a>
        <span class="avatar-tip" data-tooltip aria-haspopup="true" data-show-on="medium" data-disable-hover="false"
              tabindex="1" title="I will know that my nose has finally matured when I appreciate Dior Fahrenheit EDT. For now, I dont get the love (or like or even tolerance) of Fahrenheit. Though Ive owned a full bottle for yearsand still do, Fahrenheit is not for me. 2/10.">by
            <em>fraglawyer</em> <img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/s.1025882.jpg"

        edit_notebook:"Edit my note",
        save:"Save",
    }

    let customizePerfumePageLangVar = {
        customize_perfume_page:"Customize perfume page",
        customize_small_chart:"Small chart",
        customize_large_chart:"Large chart",
        customize_colors:"Colors",
        customize_charts_size:"Charts size",
    }

    let pulseLangVariables = {

    let done_flickity = false;

<script  data-cfasync="false">
    // Check that service workers are supported
    if ('serviceWorker' in navigator) {
        // Use the window load event to keep the page load performant
        window.addEventListener('load', () => {
            navigator.serviceWorker.register('/service-worker.js?v=rtgFFe5cbbe5e5f689826b719ace22a5b2a11');
        });
    }
</script>
